duck: Parse tree or concrete syntax tree, a tree that represents the syntactic structure of a string according to some formal grammar
Derivation (abstract algebra), a unary function satisfying the Leibniz product law
Derivation (linguistics) - In linguistics, derivation is the process of forming a new word on the basis of an existing word, e.g. happi-ness and un-happy from happy, or determination from determine.
Derivative work, a concept in United States copyright law
derivation definition: the formation of a word from another word or base (as by the addition of a usually noninflectional affix).
Formal proof or derivation, a sequence of sentences each of which is an axiom or follows from the preceding sentences in the sequence by a rule of inference

wiki.text:
'Derivation' may refer to:
* Derivation (abstract algebra), a unary function satisfying the Leibniz
  product law
* Derivation (linguistics)
* Formal proof or derivation, a sequence of sentences each of which is an axiom
  or follows from the preceding sentences in the sequence by a rule of inference
* Parse tree or concrete syntax tree, a tree that represents the syntactic
  structure of a string according to some formal grammar
* The creation of a derived row, in the twelve-tone musical technique
* An after-the-fact justification for an action, in the work of sociologist
  Vilfredo Pareto
* Derivative work, a concept in United States copyright law
wiki.title: derivation
